channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two dumped bags one like the one nearer the station, 17th June
item.description:
Two dumped bags. One black bin bag the other ripped and full of packaging from what I could see. On green area next to Bounds Green Road. This is approx location as cycling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bounds Green Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contractors fir street light's, 17th June
item.description:
They started work 6.15am with an angle grinder. When I asked rd if they had an out of hours licence they replied it was an emergency. It wasn't'. But this isv standard lie used by all workers in.these circs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Wardour Street, London

item.title: Foxes hole, 17th June
item.description:
I popped out this morning to find the path and steps dangerously covered with mud that had been spread around by foxes now living in a hole by the steps , they have been doing this the last couple of weeks and it's become quite dangerous as the mud was completely covering the steps and walk way, which I have moved the majority this morning to minimise the risk of anyone falling although this problem should be mmanaged by the council, including tidying the area with the left over dried leaves and grass from the last cutting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19A, Silverdale Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 17th June
item.description:
Litter all along the park boundary and in the gutters. Along the pavement and gutters that run along the country park fence. Elmers end Rd- between the junctions with Beck Lane and Ancaster Rd
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 211, Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Ongoing problem with glass dogs mess and leaves, 17th June
item.description:
I have reported this matter before. It is just on one section of Rodney Road (by the Peabody Estate). Its messy and a health hazard. I would be grateful if you could arrange for this to be cleared? Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heygate Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover damaged - rocking and noisy, 17th June
item.description:
Manhole cover is damaged and makes noise 24/7 when buses, lorries and cars go over it. Repair was made in March but has not lasted and manhole cover is back to rocking and making noise that can be heard streets away. Please could it be fixed properly to cope with the weight of buses and HGVs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Lavender Hill, Clapham Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet
